channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: He was experiencing psychosis. Then, his boss made a decision that saved his life
item.description: A few years ago, "A" experienced a psychotic episode. His boss made a decision that saved his life.

item.title: Energy efficiency advocates decry Trump plan to cut appliance regulations
item.description: The Trump administration wants to eliminate or weaken 47 Department of Energy regulations, including some efficiency standards for appliances. But efficiency advocates say that would be illegal.

item.title: The latest on the Menendez brothers' resentencing hearing
item.description: The long-awaited resentencing hearing for the Menendez brothers begins Tuesday. A judge will determine whether they'll get a reduced sentence. A parole board and the governor also get a say.

item.title: How did the Mavericks beat long odds to win top overall pick in the NBA draft?
item.description: The Dallas Mavericks have received the top pick in the next NBA Draft ... which has led to questions after the team traded away its star to the Los Angeles Lakers earlier this year.

item.title: On his Mideast trip, Trump plans to meet Syria's new president
item.description: Here's what President Trump did on the first full day of his trip to the Middle East.

item.title: Bay Area artist Ruby Ibarra wins the 2025 Tiny Desk Contest
item.description: Host Juana Summers talks with Ruby Ibarra, the Bay Area rapper who won this year's Tiny Desk Contest. Her winning entry, "Bakunawa," is inspired by Filipino mythology and the birth of her first child.

item.title: Diagnosing perimenopause can be difficult. Treating it can take persistence
item.description: Perimenopause is a hot topic among influencers lately. But the list of symptoms experienced during this time of life is long and can be confusing. Experts weigh in on the questions: "Is it perimenopause or is it something else?"

item.title: Author Ocean Vuong on 'the shared bond of survival' and his new novel
item.description: Author Ocean Vuong talks about his new novel, The Emperor of Gladness. It centers on the unlikely friendship between a 19-year-old college dropout and an 82-year-old with dementia.

item.title: Trump administration's universal flu vaccine project puzzles scientists
item.description: The Trump administration has launched a $500 million project to develop a universal flu vaccine that won't need yearly updates. But vaccine experts are mystified by its focus on a dated technology.
